```{r,eval=TRUE,echo=TRUE}
# Load necessary libraries
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyverse)

songs_data <- read.csv("/Users/shawnji/Documents/billboard.csv")
songs_data
# Define the dataset
# Assuming your dataset is named 'songs_data'
# Make sure the 'Year' column is in numeric format
songs_data$Year <- as.numeric(songs_data$Year)

# Filter the dataset for the specified years (2000-2001)
filtered_data <- songs_data %>%
  filter(Year >= 2000 & Year <= 2023)

# Define the genres of interest
genres_of_interest <- c('r&b', 'pop', 'hip pop', 'salsa', 'soul', 'rock', 'country', 'neo')

# Initialize an empty data frame to store genre counts
genre_counts <- data.frame(Year = numeric(), Genre = character())

# Loop through each genre and calculate the count for each year
for(genre in genres_of_interest) {
  genre_data <- filtered_data %>%
    filter(grepl(genre, Genres, ignore.case = TRUE)) %>%
    group_by(Year) %>%
    summarise(Count = n())
  genre_counts <- bind_rows(genre_counts, genre_data)
}

# Plot the trend lines
ggplot(genre_counts, aes(x = Year, y = Count, color = Genre)) +
  geom_line() +
  labs(title = "Genre Trends Over Years",
       x = "Year",
       y = "Number of Songs") +
  scale_color_manual(values = c('r&b' = 'blue', 'pop' = 'red', 'hip pop' = 'green', 
                                'salsa' = 'orange', 'soul' = 'purple', 'rock' = 'brown',
                                'country' = 'pink', 'neo' = 'cyan')) +
  theme_minimal()
```
